data.title: August 14, 2001
data.meta_description: Ribner, Sarah Burger, 98, of Ellenville, died Monday, August 13, 2001. Levine Memorial Chapel. 518-438-1002. \n Rooney, William V., 82, of Saugerties, died Thursday, August 9, 2001. Seamon-Wilsey Fune…
data.text:
Ribner, Sarah Burger, 98, of Ellenville,

died Monday, August 13, 2001. Levine

Memorial Chapel. 518-438-1002.

Rooney, William V., 82, of Saugerties, died

Thursday, August 9, 2001. Seamon-Wilsey

Funeral Home. 246-5111.

Barbieri, Gerard J., 74, of Stuart, Fla.,

died Thursday, August 9, 2001, in Stuart,

Fla. Aycock Funeral Home. 561-287-1717.

Crisci, Marian, 93, of Charlotte, N.C.,

died Friday, August 10, 2001, at home.

McEwen Funeral Service. 704-334-6421.

Clark, Barbara Ann, 66, of Newburgh, died

Saturday, August 11, in Newburgh. Brutus W.

Hodge Funeral Home. 561-4322.

Wolven, Dorothy L., 82, of Saugerties, died

Friday, August 10, 2001, in Catskill.

Seamon-Wilsey Funeral Home. 246-5111.

Funcheon, Muriel M., 78, of Riverdale,

N.J., died Sunday, August 12, 2001, at

home. Michael J. Higgins Funeral Service.

634-6110.

Logan, Margaret "Lil," 91, of Monroe, died

Sunday, August 12, 2001, in Goshen. Smith,

Seaman & Quackenbush Funeral Home.

782-8185.

Jolly, Lucy, 92, of Greenwood Lake, died

Sunday, August 12, 2001, at St. Joseph

Hospital, Flushing. Strong-Basile Funeral

Home. 488-4632.

Bloomer, Barbara Ann Lange, 50, of

Middlehope, entered into rest Sunday,

August 12, 2001. Halvey Funeral Home.

845-831-0380.

Short, Jay Alan, 44, of Tarpon Springs,

Fla., died Wednesday, August 8, 2001, in

the State of Florida. Sylvan Abbey Funeral

Home. 727-796-1992.

Abbate, Martin C., 84, of Highland, died

Monday, August 13, 2001, at home. Michael

Torsone Memorial Funeral Home. 691-2281.

Williams, Elizabeth, 86, of Newburgh, died

Sunday, August 12, 2001, in Goshen. Doulin

Newburgh Funeral Home. 562-0068.

Rauhofer, Mary A., of Greenburgh, died

Friday, August 10, 2001, at Westechester

Medical Center, Valhalla. McElroy-Flynn

Funeral Home. 914-592-6300.

Kostka, John R., 72, of Montague, N.J.,

died Sunday, August 12, 2001, at Bon

Secours Community Hospital, Port Jervis.

Knight-Auchmoody Funeral Home. 856-3312.

Napolitano, Joseph, 80, of Eustis, Fla.,

died Tuesday, August 7, 2001, at Florida

Hospital Waterman, Eustis, Fla. Coloni

Funeral Home. 561-0238.

Lawder, Marguerite Osterhout, 94, of

Middletown, died Monday, August 13, 2001,

at Park Manor Nursing Home, Middletown.

Morse Funeral Home. 343-6918.

Strang, Dolores, 71, of Newburgh, died

Wednesday, August 8, 2001, in Westchester

Medical Center, Valhalla. Doulin Newburgh

Funeral Home. 562-0068.

DeWitt, Dorothy T, 68, of Kerhonkson, died

Sunday, August 12, 2001, at Benedictine

Hospital, Kingston. H.B. Humiston Funeral

Home. 626-3331.

BARBARA ANN CLARK

Newburgh, N.Y.Barbara Ann Clark of Newburgh, a homemaker

and 50-year resident of the area, died

Saturday, August 11, 2001, at Newburgh. She

was 66.She was born April 18, 1935, in New York,

N.Y.Survivors include her husband, Joseph

Lewis Clark Sr.; seven stepchildren,

Charles Clark Matthews of Va., Jolene,

Colleen and Anthony Clark, all of Newburgh,

Sonya McCracken of Poughkeepsie, Juanita

Conley of Dale City, Va., and Joseph Clark

Jr. of Wilmington, N.C.; and 15

grandchildren.There will be no visitation.Private services will be held at 5 p.m.

Wednesday, August 15, at the Brutus W.

Hodge Funeral Home, 13 Chambers St.,

Newburgh. The Rev. Joseph Clark Jr. will

officiate.Cremation will be at the convenience of

the family.Arrangements were made by Brutus W. Hodge

Funeral Home.

DOROTHY T. DeWITT

Kerhonkson, N.Y.Dorothy T. DeWitt of Kerhonkson, a former

Telephone Operator with New York Telephone,

died Sunday, August 12, 2001, at

Benedictine Hospital, Kingston. She was

68.The daughter of the late Earl C. and

Catherine McCafferty Terwilliger, she was

born July 27, 1933, in New York City.Surviving is her husband of 47 years, John

DeWitt Sr. They were married June 20, 1954.

She is also survived by a daughter,

Patricia DeWitt of Kerhonkson; and a son,

John DeWitt Jr. of Albany. Several cousins,

nieces and nephews also survive.She was predeceased by a sister, Patricia

Terwilliger Jonas.A graveside service under the direction of

the H.B. Humiston Funeral Home will be held

at 11 a.m. Wednesday, August 15, at the

Pine Bush Cemetery. Monsignor Robert Hickey

will officiate.

ELIZABETH WILLIAMS

Newburgh, N.Y.Elizabeth Williams of Newburgh entered

into rest Sunday, August 12, 2001, at

Orange County Residential Health Care

Facility, Goshen. She was 86.The daughter of the late Sophie Nagy, she

was born September 8, 1914, in Garfield,

N.J.She was the widow of Charles M. Kovacs and

William Williams.Survivors include three sons, Charles M.

Kovacs of Ukiah, Calif., Joseph A. Kovacs

of Middletown, and Steven J. Kovacs of

Raleigh, N.C.; one daughter, Elizabeth Ann

Appleby of Cornwall; 16 grandchildren; and

13 great-grandchildren.Visitation will be from 9 to 11:30 a.m.

Wednesday, August 15, at Doulin Newburgh

Funeral Home Inc., 318 North Montgomery

St., Newburgh.Services will be at 11:30 a.m. Wednesday,

August 15, at Doulin Newburgh Funeral Home

Inc. The Rev. Carlos Lantis will

officiate.Burial will be in Cedar Hill Cemetery,

Newburgh.Arrangements provided by Doulin Newburgh

Funeral Home Inc.

LUCY JOLLY

Greenwood Lake, N.Y.Lucy Jolly, a housewife and 31-year

resident of Greenwood Lake, entered into

rest Sunday, August 12, 2001, at St. Joseph

Hospital, Flushing. She was 92.She was born December 1, 1908, in Poland.She was the widow of James Jolly.She was a member of Holy Rosary Church,

Greenwood Lake.Survivors include one son, James and his

wife Carmella Jolly of Greenwood Lake; one

brother, Vincent Brown of the State of

Florida; four grandchildren; and two

great-grandchildren.The family will receive friends from 6 to

9 p.m. today, Tuesday, August 14, at the

Strong-Basile Funeral Home, 4 Oak St.,

Greenwood Lake.Services will be at 10 a.m. tomorrow,

Wednesday, August 15, at Holy Rosary

Church, Greenwood Lake. The Rev. John

Pierce, O.F.M. will officiate.The burial will be in St. Stephen

Cemetery, Warwick.In lieu of flowers, memorial contributions

may be made to Holy Rosary Church,

Greenwood Lake, NY 10925.Funeral arrangements entrusted to the

Strong-Basile Funeral Home.

GERARD J. BARBIERI

Stuart, Fla.Gerard J. Barbieri of Stuart, Fla., died

Thursday, August 9, 2001, at Martin

Memorial Medical Center, Stuart, Fla. He

was 74.Born in Muro Lucano, Italy, he was a

resident of Stuart for five years, moving

from New Windsor, N.Y.He served in the U.S. Navy, as well as the

Merchant Marines.Prior to retirement, he was employed by

the U.S. Postal Service for 20 years;

previous to that, he was a sales

representative for John Harrison & Co. in

Greenwich, Conn.He was preceded in death by his wife,

Genevieve.Survivors include a daughter, Kathleen

Barbieri Kalberer and husband Roderick of

Cincinnati, Ohio; a son, Kenneth Barbieri

and wife Juanita of Port St. Lucie, Fla.;

one grandson, Lee Schadt; one sister, Alice

Gagliardi of Basking Ridge, N.J.; one

brother, Nicholas Barbieri and wife Yga of

New York City; and many nieces and

nephews.Funeral services will be held at 11 a.m.

Thursday, August 16, at St. Mary's Chapel,

Ahearn Blvd., Washingtonville.Burial will be in St. Mary's Cemetery,

Washingtonville.Arrangements are under the direction of

Aycock Funeral Home, Stuart, Fla.

MARIAN CRISCI

Charlotte, N.C.Marian Crisci of Charlotte, N.C., formerly

of Tuxedo, N.Y., died peacefully at home on

Friday, August 10, 2001, after a short

illness. She was 93 years old.She was born on November 12, 1907, in Port

Chester, N.Y., to William and Priscilla

Potter Smith. Mrs. Crisci lived in Tuxedo,

N.Y. for more than 70 years, where she

taught kindergarten in Tuxedo School

District for 32 years.She was preceded in death by her husband

of 63 years, Emanuel "Mike" Crisci. She is

survived by a son and daughter-in-law, Jack

and Corky Crisci of San Antonio, Tex.; a

daughter and son-in-law, Priscilla and

James Perkins; and a daughter, Marian L.

Crisci, all of Charlotte, N.C.; six

grandchildren; two stepgrandchildren; four

great-grandchildren; and numerous nieces

and nephews. She was preceded in death by

her sisters, Wilhemina and Jennie Smith;

and by her brother Edward Smith.Mrs Crisci will always be remembered as a

devoted and loving mother, and a patient

and caring teacher to her students. She

will be sadly missed by her many family and

friends that she has touched throughout her

life.In lieu of flowers, donations may be made

to Hospice at Charlotte, 1420 East Seventh

St., Charlotte, NC 28204.Arrangements are by McEwen Funeral and

Cremation Service, Charlotte Chapel at the

convenience of the family.

JOSEPH NAPOLITANO

Eustis, Fla.Joseph Napolitano of Eustis, Fla., a

Machinist with Knowmark Corp., Brooklyn,

entered into rest on Tuesday, August 7,

2001, at Florida Hospital Waterman, Eustis,

Florida. He was 80.Joseph was born in Brooklyn on August 3,

1921, the son of Giovanni and Maria

Montemurrow Napolitano.Joseph served his country during World War

II in the Army Air Corps, for which he

received the Distinguished Flying Cross,

Distinguished Unit Medal, and also the Air

Medal with five Oak Leaf Clusters.Joseph is survived by his son, Joseph

Napolitano of Cornwall; two daughters, Mary

McDonough and Natalie Navarro, both of

Cornwall; two brothers, Salvatore

Napolitano of Brooklyn, and Thomas

Napolitano of Long Island; a sister, Sadie

Napolitano of Brooklyn; seven

grandchildren; two great-grandchildren; and

several nieces and nephews.Friends will be received from noon to —

p.m. on Thursday, August 16, at the Coloni

Funeral Home, Route 9W, New Windsor.A memorial service will be held at — p.m.

on Thursday, August 16, at the funeral

home.Entombment will take place at 2 p.m. on

Thursday, August 30, in Arlington National

Cemetery, Va.Funeral arrangements are under the

direction of the Coloni Funeral Home, New

Windsor. For directions and guest book,

please go to www.Legacy.com.

MARGUERITE OSTERHOUT LAWDER

Middletown, N.Y.Marguerite Osterhout Lawder of Middletown,

a retired Stenographer for the Middletown

Board of Education, Dairymen league and

Middletown State Hospital, and a lifetime

area resident, died peacefully on Monday,

August 13, 2001, at Park Manor Nursing

Home, Middletown. She was 94.The daughter of Walter A. and Mary

McCauley Osterhout, she was born on January

2, 1902, in Middletown. Devoted wife of the

late Edward Donald Lawder. Member of St.

Joseph Catholic Church; the Alter Rosary

Society; Golden Age Seniors of Mulberry

House, Horton Hospital Auxiliary; and

R.S.V.P. Dearest Mother of Walter E. Lawder

and his wife Elizabeth of New City; Loving

Grandmother of Catherine Lawder of

Richmond, Va., and Elizabeth Grotos and her

husband Leif of Arlington, Va.; one

great-granddaughter, Mary Alexander Grotos

of Arlington, Va.; Loving Aunt of Mary

Bond, Jane Schmidt, Ann Hoefner, Sharon

Brophy and the Blizzard families.Friends may call from 6:30 to 8 p.m.

tomorrow, Wednesday, August 15, at the

Morse Funeral Home Inc., 33 Railroad Ave.,

Middletown.A Mass of the Christian Burial will be

celebrated at 9:30 a.m. Thursday, August

16, in St. Joseph R.C. Church, 149 Cottage

St., Middletown.Burial will be in the family plot in St.

Joseph Cemetery, Middletown.Arrangements are under the direction of

Morse Funeral Home, Middletown.

www.morsefh.com.

SARAH BURGER RIBNER

Ellenville, N.Y.Sarah Burger Ribner of Ellenville died

peacefully on Monday, August 13, 2001. She

was 98.Mrs. Ribner was born in Hungary and came

to the United States in the 1940s. She

resided for many years in Port Jervis, and

in Ellenville for 45 years. She was a

member of Congregation Ezrath Israel in

Ellenville, and their sisterhood. She was

also a member of Hadassah in Ellenville.She was married to Abraham David Ribner

until his passing in 1978. Mother of

Lorriane Bernzweig and her husband Eli of

Palo Alto, Calif., and Bernice Rogow of

Ellenville. She was the mother-in-law of

the late Harry Rogow.Mrs. Ribner was predeceased by two sons,

Issac Ribner and Dr. Richard "Sunny"

Ribner. Grandmother of Melinda Ribner, Sara

Beth Nealy and her husband Keith, Stephen

Ribner and his wife Andrea, and Linda

Rhodes. Great-grandmother of Jessica

Ribner, Joni Ribner, Bobbi Ribner, Roxana

Rhodes, Stefanie Rhodes, Zachary, Alexander

and Liandra Nealy.Services at Congregation Ezrath Israel, 38

Center St., Ellenville, today, Tuesday,

August 14, at 11:30 a.m. Interment will

follow in the Ezrath Israel Cemetery in

Ellenville.Memorial contributions may be made to

Congregation Ezrath Israel.Funeral arrangements have been entrusted

to the Levine Memorial Chapel, 649

Washington Ave., Albany.

BARBARA ANN LANGE BLOOMER

Middlehope, N.Y.Barbara Ann Lange Bloomer of Middlehope

entered into rest Sunday, August 12, 2001

at St. Luke's Hospital, Newburgh after a

lengthy illness. She was 50.The daughter of Robert E. Lange and the

late Marion A. Lange, she was born June 4,

1951 in Newburgh.Barbara was a professional vocalist with

several area bands throughout the years.She is survived by her husband, Robert K.

Bloomer and their beloved puppy, Corey

James, at home; her father, Robert E. Lange

of Beacon; her sister, Jill Lombardo and

her husband, Frank of Poughkeepsie; two

nephews, John Dunderale and Dominick

Lombardo; four aunts, Helen Basso of

Tivoli, Irene Pulcastro and Alma Pappas,

both of Dutchess Junction, and Jacqueline

Soltish of Beacon; and one uncle, George

Caruso of Ohio.Friends may call from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9

p.m., Thursday, August 16, 2001 at Halvey

Funeral Home, 24 Willow St., Beacon.Prayers will be offered at 8:30 p.m. at

the funeral home with Pastor Ray Spangler

officiating.Cremation will be at the convenience of

the family.In lieu of flowers, memorial donations in

Barbara's name can be made to either

Hospice of Orange County, 800 Stony Brook

Court, Newburgh, NY 12550 or the ASPCA, 568

Violet Ave., Hyde Park, NY 12538.Arrangements are under the direction of

the Halvey Funeral Home, 24 Willow St.,

Beacon, N.Y.

JAY ALAN SHORT

Tarpon Springs, Fla.Jay Alan Short of Tarpon Springs, Fla.,

the Food & Beverage Director at the Holiday

Inn, Tarpon, Fla., died Wednesday, August

8, 2001, at Helen Ellis Memorial Hospital,

Fla. He was 44.Born in Spring Valley, Ill., he came to

the State of Florida from Syracuse, N.Y. in

1979.He was a 1975 graduate of Port Jervis High

School; and of the Culinary Institute of

America, Poughkeepsie. He enjoyed music and

played several instruments. He also enjoyed

riding his motorcycle.Survivors include his companion, Kay

Bigman of Tarpon Springs, Fla.; a son,

Jesse Jay Short of Largo, Fla.; his

parents, Gordon and Joanne Short of

Plainfield, Ill.; a brother, Thomas Short

and his wife Audrey of Greensburg, Penn.;

three sisters, Lynn and her husband Peter

Gillespie of Wheaton, Ill., Beth and her

husband Rene Ghadimi, of Chicago, Ill., and

Amy Short, also of Chicago, Ill.; and a

grandmother, Kathryn Lolli of Spring

Valley, Ill.Visitation was held on Sunday, August 12,

at the funeral home.Services were held at 10 a.m. Monday,

August 13, at Sylvan Abbey Funeral Home,

2853 Sunset Point Road, Clearwater, Fla.In lieu of flowers, a fund has been

established for Jesse Jay Short, and anyone

wishing to make a contribution may send it

in care of Thomas Short, 514 Mace St.,

Greensburg, PA 15601.Arrangements are by Sylvan Abbey Funeral

Home, Clearwater, Fla. Please sign the

online guest book at

www.sylvanabbeympfh.com.

JOHN R. KOSTKA

Montague, N.J.John R, Kostka of Montague, N.J., a

retired Truck Driver for the Daily Record

newspaper in Parsippany, N.J., and a

resident of the area for many years, died

Sunday, August 12, 2001, at Bon Secours

Community Hospital, Port Jervis. He was

72.The son of the late John A. Kostka and

Julia Oravits Kostka who survives, he was

born July 23, 1929, in Boonton, N.J.He was a member of St. James The Greater

R.C. Church, Montague, N.J.; and a Veteran

of the U.S. Army, Korean Conflict.Survivors include his wife, Mary Ann Oney

Kostka, at home; his mother, Julia Oravits

Kostka of Montague, N.J.; five daughters,

Karen Corrigan and her husband Michael of

Jamestown, Lorrainne Wolosin and her

husband Rev. Steven Wolosin of Oak Ridge,

Colleen Buresh and her husband Joseph of

Sparta, N.J., Carolanne Baden and her

husband Mark of Niceville, Fla., Suzanne

Coykendall of Ft. Walton Beach, Fla.; 15

grandchildren; five great-grandchildren;

and several nieces and nephews.He was predeceased by his son, Charles

Miller; and his sister, Elaine Padavano.Friends may call from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9

p.m. today, Tuesday, August 14, at the

Knight-Auchmoody Funeral Home, 154 East

Main St., Port Jervis. Prayers will be

offered at 2:15 p.m. this Tuesday afternoon

at the funeral home.A Mass of Christian Burial will be

celebrated at 11 a.m. tomorrow, Wednesday,

August 15, at St. James The Greater R.C.

Church, Montague, N.J. The Rev. Gerald

Lewis will officiate.Burial will be in Milford cemetery,

Milford, Penn.Contributions may be made to The Blue

Ridge Rescue Squad, Montague, NJ 07827.Funeral arrangements by the

Knight-Auchmoody Funeral Home, Port

Jervis.

MURIEL M. FUNCHEON

Riverdale, N.J.Muriel M. Funcheon of Riverdale, N.J.,

formerly of Tomkins Cove, N.Y., passed away

on Sunday, August 12, 2001, peacefully at

her home with her family at her side. She

was 78.She was born on July 24, 1923 in Queens,

N.Y. to Felix and Margaret Nevins Gannon.Muriel lived in Tomkins Cove from 1954

till 1989 before moving to Calabash, N.C.

for five years. She married her husband

Edward in Maspeth, Queens, in 1945. She

worked at Tomkins Cove Library for many

years, and was a Licensed Practical Nurse

at Helen Hayes Hospital for many years.Muriel was a member of the V.F.W. Ladies

Auxiliary in Tompkins Cove; and a member of

Immaculate Conception Church in Stony

Point.Muriel was a devoted mother and

grandmother who touched the lives of

everyone who knew her. Muriel is predeceased by her husband

Edward; and two sons, Edward and Paul.She is survived by her children, William

and Alexa of Stony Point, James of

Lakeworth, Fla., John & Lee of Lakeworth,

Fla., Thomas & MaryJean of Washingtonville,

N.Y., Philip and Donna of Parksville, N.Y.,

Muriel and Peter Greenstein of Lakeworth,

Fla., Peggy and Vernon June of Riverdale,

N.J.; also 16 grandchildren and five

great-grandchildren.The family will receive friends from 7 to

9 p.m. today, Tuesday, August 14, and from

2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. tomorrow,

Wednesday, August 15, at the Higgins

Funeral Home in Stony Point.A Mass of Christian Burial will be

celebrated at 11 a.m. Thursday, August 16,

at Immaculate Conception Church, Stony

Point, with interment to follow in the F.

Loescher Co. Veterans Cemetery.In lieu of flowers, memorial donations can

be made in Muriel's memory to the Riverdale

Ambulance Corps, Riverdale Road, Riverdale,

NJ 07457; or Bergen Co. Hospice, 400 Old

Hook Road, Westwood, NJ 07675.Arrangements by Michael J. Higgins Funeral

Service, Route 9W, Stony Point.

MARGARET "LIL" LOGAN

Monroe, N.Y.Margaret "Lil" Logan of Monroe, a

housewife and 24-year resident of the area,

died Sunday, August 12, 2001, at Orange

County Residential Health Care Facility,

Goshen. She was 91.The daughter of Francis Carroll and Ann

Alexander Carroll, both deceased, she was

born December 8, 1909, in County Mayo,

Ireland. She was the fourth of seven

children.She was the widow of Thomas M. Morgan.She was a member of Sacred Heart Church,

Monroe; a member of Catholic Daughters,

Court Margaret Mary; Blooming Grove Senior

Citizens; Sacred Heart & Blooming Grove

Quilting Clubs; Ladies Auxiliary,

Independence Fire Company; Monroe Seniors;

and the Alter Society, Blessed Sacrament

Church, Bronx.A family statement read: "Lil was an

exceptional lady who, in her quiet,

unassuming way, touched the hearts of all

who knew her. To know her was to love her,

and she will be dearly missed by all her

family and friends."Survivors include a daughter, Madelyn

Ortel and her husband Peter of Monroe;

three sons, John Logan and his wife Renee

of Pequannock, N.J., Thomas Logan and his

wife Mary Ann of Longs, S.C., and William

Logan of New York, N.Y.; three

granddaughters, Laura Logan Friedman and

her husband Michael, Lisa Logan Spadafino

and her husband John, and Janice Logan;

four grandsons, Peter Ortel Jr. and his

wife Donnette, Thomas Ortel, Robert Ortel

and his wife Terrilynn, and Michael Logan;

five great-grandchildren, Holly, Carolyn,

Andrew, Caprice and Christian; and several

nieces and nephews.Friends may call from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9

p.m. tomorrow, Wednesday, August 15, at

Smith, Seaman & Quackenbush Inc., 117 Maple

Ave., Monroe, NY 10950.A funeral Mass will be celebrated at 10

a.m. Thursday, August 16, at Sacred Heart

Church, 26 still Road, Monroe. The Rev.

George Pulparayil will officiate.Burial will be in St. Raymond's Cemetery,

Bronx.Funeral arrangements by Smith, Seaman &

Quackenbush Inc., Monroe.

MARTIN C. ABBATE

Highland, N.Y.Martin C. Abbate, a lifelong resident of

Highland, died Monday, August 13, 2001, at

home. He was 84.The son of Ciro Abbate and Beatrice

Canale, he was born October 15, 1916, in

Lodi, N.J.He married Rose Currie on June 28, 1942,

in St. Augustine Roman Catholic Church,

Highland.A graduate of Highland Central Schools, he

worked at White Swan Uniform Company in

Highland as a Production Manager for 17

years; as a projectionist for the Highland

Theater; a bus driver for 15 years for the

Highland Central School District; and at

IBM for 27 years as a Senior Methods

Specialist, retiring in 1981.He was a member of St. Augustine Church in

Highland; a member of the American Legion

Post #193 in Highland for over 40 years,

serving one term as First Vice Commander; a

member of the Highland Fire Dept. as an

active member for 16 years, and currently

an exempt member; served for 27 years as

custodian of voting machines for the Town

of Lloyd. Mr. Abbate entered the Army in

January, 1943 during World War II and

served in the South Pacific for 15 months.

He was honorably discharged at Fort Dix in

November, 1945, with the rank of Technical

Sergeant.Survivors include his wife, Rose Abbate,

at home; three daughters, Rosemarie

Illustrato and son-in-law Victor of

LaGrange, Patricia Loos and son-in-law

William of Hopewell Junction, and Karen

Marino and son-in-law John of Hyde Park;

one son, Martin Abbate and daughter-in-law

Christine of Broadview Heights, Ohio; one

sister, Grace Litts of Highland; one

brother, Charles Abbate of Highland; nine

grandchildren; two great-grandchildren;

several nieces and nephews.He was predeceased by one brother, Philip

Abbate.Calling hours are from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9

p.m. tomorrow, Wednesday, August 15, at the

Michael Torsone Memorial Funeral Home, 38

Main St., Highland.A Mass of Christian Burial will be

celebrated at 9:30 a.m. Thursday, August

16, at St. Augustine Roman Catholic Church

in Highland.Burial will follow at St. Peters Cemetery

in Poughkeepsie, with Military Honors.Arrangements by Michael Torsone Memorial

Funeral Home, Highland.
